group_1.narration: For some reason,@her voice would not carve into the record.@This had never happened before.
How can this be? My song is being left out!
The goddess was very upset,@and gradually it gave way to anxiety.
She decided to listen to the record@from the beginning again.
I have heard this song before...
The start of the record was, of course,@filled with songs she had heard many times.@She had blessed each with her own song.
No matter how many times she strained to @listen to their songs or how long she stared@at them, that didn't change.
So I really should know this record.
She racked her mind for an explanation and@decided to listen to the end of the record.
None of this had happened before.@The goddess's anxiety began@to morph into a panic.
Now, and long ago, and far into the future,@and from every angle and area,@she held infinite knowledge of all things@from where she sat quietly in the heavens,@watching over Magical Girls.
That was what it meant to be the goddess@of Magical Girls, and yet she could@not listen to the end of this record.
Suspicion bloomed in her toward the songs@she had only just listened to so raptly.
A girl surrounded by machines, studying space.@A girl in her bed, spinning stories for all.@A girl burning her short life to give light.@And a girl devoted to each of those girls.
Every one of their singing voices rang clear@and sweet. But in all her millions of years,@in all her trips across time and space...
The goddess had never heard any of@their songs until she stumbled upon@this new, mysterious record.
